Job Posting:170727 - Position: F25 Co-op/Intern, Data Engineering - Fall 2025 170727 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 06/30/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 06/16/2025 12:01 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Hootsuite Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode 2025 - Fall F25 Co-op/Intern, Data Engineering - Fall 2025 170727 Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months To be confirmed Salary Currency CAD Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $46,100 - $55,400 Title: Co-op/Intern, Data Engineering - Fall 2025 Location: Toronto, ON or Vancouver, BC Term: 4 months Start Date: September 8, 2025 Openings: 1 Overview: Our Data Analysis & Visualization team seeks motivated and proactive co-op students to join us for the Fall 2025 term. The successful candidates will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, learning and contributing to various Finance functions while developing their skills. Responsibilities by Team (could include but are not limited to): In this role, you will be integral to the development and maintenance of our data infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to work with large datasets and contribute to the foundation of our data-driven insights. • Design, construct, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes to support our analytics and business intelligence teams. • Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide robust, efficient data solutions. • Contribute to the enhancement of our data architecture, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accessibility across the organization. Develop documentation for data models, data flows, and system processes to support knowledge sharing and team collaboration. • Benefits: • Gain hands-on experience in Data Analysis & Visualizations Operations. • Develop and enhance data-driven knowledge and skills. • Opportunity to work with a dynamic and collaborative team. Potential for future employment opportunities upon completion of the co-op term. • Job Requirements Requirements • Currently enrolled in a post-secondary program, preferably in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field. • Proficiency in a programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala. • Solid understanding of SQL and experience with relational or non-relational databases. • Familiarity with data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL/ELT concepts. • Strong problem-solving skills and a keen eye for detail. • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment. A demonstrated passion for data engineering and an eagerness to learn new technologies. • WHO YOU ARE: • Solution seeker: You're focused on tackling new challenges, solving problems, and moving the business forward-and you don't wait to be asked. • Lifelong learner: You have a growth mindset - you're here to learn, experiment, seek, apply, and provide feedback, share what works with your team, and move on from what doesn't. • Resilient adapter: In the face of change and challenges, you bring a thoughtful, calm approach and a focus on finding new opportunities. • Intentional collaborator. You build positive working relationships across the business, bringing people together to foster new opportunities and to facilitate the efficient flow of information. • Critical challenger: You have the trust in your team to ask difficult questions in order to get to the best end result. • Active communicator: You listen actively and communicate ideas and information clearly, inclusively, and proactively. • Integrated thinker: You look beyond your role and responsibilities to understand how your team's work drives broader organizational goals. • Accountable owner: You take pride in the work you're responsible for with a mindset of ultimate accountability and reliability for the outcomes. Bar-raiser: You step up to help your team grow and succeed, even when that means going beyond what might be expected. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: Job Posting Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received.
